intro: Asphodelus olbiensis, commonly known as the Corsican asphodel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It is noted for its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. Asphodelus olbiensis plays a role in local ecosystems and has been historically used in traditional medicine.
